intro: Rinorea afzelii var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy rinorea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or white. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
